sentence.Network_en: We won't dignify this kind of speculation with a comment.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种猜测不值得我们作任何评论。

sentence.Network_en: The mayor was there to dignify the celebrations.
sentence.Network_cn: 市长的光临为庆祝活动增辉。

sentence.Network_en: Don't try to dignify those few hairs on your face by calling them a beard!
sentence.Network_cn: 别想把你脸上那几根毛说成是胡子来美化它!

list.abs: 猎狼哪个漂亮 ... Carries himself in a calm,dignified manner 持有冷静，威严的态度 Is polite with people 对人有礼貌.
I hope you are also is filial , dignified girl ., 我希望你也是位孝顺 , 端庄的女孩.
her dignified bearing throughout the trial made everyone believe she was innocent .在整个审讯的过程中，她那端庄的举止使得每个人都相信她是无辜的。

the palatial dignified construction main body , is located in carpet of green grass , the flowers and trees luxuriant Zhongshan Park , becomes east Taibei an area radiant star ;巍峨庄严的建筑本体，座落在绿草如茵，花木扶疏的中山公园，成为台北东区一颗璀璨的明星；

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French dignefier, from late Latin dignificare, from Latin dignus 'worthy'

entry.tran: 使有尊严;使变得庄严;使变得高贵
entry.def: To dignify something means to make it impressive.

example.ex: Tragic literature dignifies sorrow and disaster...
example.tran: 悲剧作品使悲伤和灾难得到了升华。

example.ex: The gatepost was dignified by the weathered brass plate of Dr Harcourt Sibley.
example.tran: 在那块刻有哈考特·西布利医生姓名的久经风雨的黄铜牌映衬下，门柱更增添了几分庄重。

entry.tran: 使显得堂皇;抬高…的身价;美化
entry.def: If you say that a particular reaction or description dignifies something you have a low opinion of, you mean that it makes it appear acceptable.

example.ex: We won't dignify this kind of speculation with a comment...
example.tran: 这种猜测不值得我们作任何评论。

example.ex: It was a technique later dignified by the term 'info-tainment'.
example.tran: 那种技术后来被美其名曰“资讯娱乐”。

sentences.sentence: "I shall not dignify this insensitive remark with an answer"

auth_sentence.content: A Royal Duke, with no campaigning medals To dignify his orders.
auth_sentence.res_content: A Royal Duke, with no campaigning medals To dignify his orders.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A Royal Duke, with no campaigning medals To dignify his orders.

auth_sentence.content: We should not dignify it as more than that until it is.
auth_sentence.res_content: We should not dignify it as more than that until it is.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We should not dignify it as more than that until it is.

auth_sentence.content: There is no way to dignify the description of death by starvation.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is no way to dignify the description of death by starvation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is no way to dignify the description of death by starvation.

stems_affixes.word_buile: con大家+dign值得→大家都觉得应该惩罚
in不+dign高贵的+ant表形容词→[因发脾气]不高贵的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 权贵, 高官, 高僧
stems_affixes.word_buile: dign值得,高贵+itary表示总称"人"→高贵之人

stems_affixes.value_cn: [举止,态度等的]庄严,端庄;尊贵,高贵
stems_affixes.word_buile: dign值得,高贵+ity表名词→n.[举止,态度等的]庄严,端庄;尊贵,高贵
indignant[[adj.愤慨的,愤慨不平的]]础鷑.愤怒,愤慨
in不+dign值得,高贵+ity表名词→不高贵
dign值得,高贵+ify……化→v.使高贵, 使显赫

means.word_mean: 使显得威严, 使高贵, 使显赫

sentences.en: He always strikes such a dignified pose before his girlfriend.
sentences.cn: 他总是在女友面前摆出这种庄严的姿态。

sentences.en: Don’t try to dignify those few hairs on your face by calling them a beard!
sentences.cn: 别想把你脸上那几根毛说成是胡子来美化它！
